data.title: MOVED. No longer there.
data.text: You will really have to look for Nicamex if you plan on eating there. It has moved to 15th Street, near corner of Krome Ave. While I have not yet visited the new location, the food at the old location was pretty good.

data.title: Nicamex is Back
data.text:
Good Mexican food.  Tacos are authentic.  Portions are filling and prices are quite affordable.  Chips and pico de gallo (excellent with a slight spicy kick) on the table while you wait for your meal. Family of six 6 for < $60.
The new location is 22 NE 15th Street, where the old Oasis Tiki Bar and Grill was

data.title: Best mexican restaurant in Homestead is gone!
data.text: Im heartbroken!  El Nicamex has been leveled!  It is gone!  The whole area is a construction site.  Going to be a Dollar Store or something else!  We always stopped there!  It was the best in Homestead!  We've looked everywhere to see if they've moved, but can't find them!  Just want you to know.

data.title: Best Mexican food in Homestead1
data.text: We have been to every Mexican restaurant in Homestead and this is the absolute best!  We live in the Keys and always make it a point to stop here.  Salsa and chips are homemade, with great cilantro flavor and fresh made chips.  The best dish here is the pork chunks in green sauce.  LOVE IT!  Have it everytime we go.  Always hot, with homemade tortillas, beans and rice.  You can't beat the flavor.  Gotta stop here for sure!

data.title: Good food! Good prices! Poor service!
data.text: Food is great for great price but poor service!  We stopped by on our way to home (coming back from Florida's keys), my boyfriend asked for tostones and fried cheese as an appetizer,  but the girl misunderstood and brought the cheese first and then the tostones! There were two girls serving but the order girl was like we didn't exist!

data.title: Good food, great prices!
data.text:
Our guidebook recommended this place for good Mexican fare. It was on a quiet little dead end street and is very unassuming. The free chips and salsa provided to you when you sit down were very authentic and quite tasty. The enchiladas were excellent and the tacos were good (great shells but lacking a little on the contents other than the meat).  
The price blows you away as we both ate dinner for a total of $10 ( without drinks). 
We would like to go back to try out more of their menu.

data.title: Great hole in the wall
data.text: Delicious, inexpensive Mexican food. Not fancy by any means but the restaurant is clean and the employees were very friendly.

data.title: Eat Mexican food where the locals go.
data.text: I asked myself "Can a restaurant that serves food on plastic plates with plastic tablecloths be able to achieve 5 on the TA scale?" The answer I decided was yes it can. The food is genuine Mexican cuisine cooked mostly for the local community but it is of high quality. Staff are pleasant and helpful and the food arrives efficiently. Prices are very reasonable - $8 will buy you a substantial meal. So if you find yourself in this gateway town on the way to the Keys then drop in for a great meal.

data.title: Best in Florida
data.text: I have been going to Nicamex since it opened, I live in the Keys and always stop and eat at Nicamex whenever I come to the mainland. I lived in Ca. For many years and traveled all through Mexico. This family owned restuarant is the BEST Home cooked Mexican food I have found in Florida. The customers are almost all Latinos, however everyone. Is polite and great service and prices. Do your self a favor and be sure to check this hidden jewel out . I haven't had a bad meal in this place since it opened about 20 years ago.          George and Shirl.

data.title: Awesome Mexican Food
data.text: I will tell you now.  This expatriate Texan knows his Mexican food, Forget Casita Tejas.  The food is great.  The authentic taste and menu selection are from S Texas and N Mexico infulence.  The salsas are spot on with good flavor and heat.  The place is typical of homestead and not much to look at, but do not judge the book by its cover.  I will admit the service was a bit slow, but I will continue to go back as much as possible to support this local eatery.  Thank God someone knows what they are doing here in South Florida.

data.title: Low key. Low price. Good food!
data.text:
Walked in a very basic restaurant. 
Service good. Salsa ok. The burrito
Good. All and all great value. I will be back.

data.title: Good chips
data.text:
Fast service but Tacos are not that authentic..lots of lettuce and tomatoes. No onions or Cilantrillo only one type of Sauce.

Rice and Beans were Good. The best Chips and Salsa I have tasted.

Good prices but I liked Casitas Tejas better.

data.title: Would drive an hour to go there
data.text: If you like mexican taquerias, here is a real one. Other than the desserts, everything is home-made, delicious, and ridiculously low-priced. Local mexicans are the main clientele, adding to the authenticity. We tried El Toro Taco, drove an hour for it, and didn't care for it. This one - we loved.
